paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses engineered mutants of the TTR gene, specifically the double mutant F87M/L110M and the triple mutant F87M/L110M/S117E, but does not provide specific penetrance data or individual patient information.

functional_data.summary: The double mutant F87M/L110M (MT-TTR) and the triple mutant F87M/L110M/S117E (3M-TTR) were engineered to promote the dissociation of TTR tetramer into monomers.

variants.additional_notes: The paper mentions that the three mutations are not reported in the ClinVar database, and that about 80 point mutations have been correlated to human inherited amyloidosis.
key_quotes: To mimic the pathological situation, previous site-directed mutagenesis, namely, mutation F87M/L110M (MT-TTR), was carried out to promote the dissociation of TTR tetramer into monomers.
Indeed, the latter mutant containing three mutations (3M-TTR) proved to be markedly more prone to in vitro monomerization in comparison with the double mutant MT-TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily discusses the structural and functional implications of the TTR mutations without providing detailed clinical or penetrance data.
